sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Capsule Polishing Machine for removal of dust and powder residues from the surface of filled capsules to improve appearance and quality.
sections.scope: Applicable to capsule polishing activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the machine is placed on a stable surface in a clean environment.
Verify that the dust extraction system or vacuum connection is functional.
Check that the polishing drum and brushes are clean and in good condition.
Power ON the capsule polishing machine and vacuum system.
Set the polishing time and drum rotation speed as per product requirements.
Adjust vacuum suction intensity to remove dust without damaging capsules.
Load filled capsules into the polishing drum (do not overload).
Close the drum lid securely to prevent capsule escape.
Start the polishing cycle and allow the machine to run for the set duration.
Monitor the operation for any unusual noise or vibration.
After completion, stop the machine and wait for drum to come to complete stop.
Open the drum lid carefully and collect the polished capsules.
Inspect capsules for proper cleaning and absence of surface powder.
Verify that capsules are not damaged during polishing process.
Check for any broken or cracked capsules and segregate them.
Collect polished capsules in clean containers for further processing or packaging.
Empty the dust collection chamber and dispose of collected powder.
Clean the polishing drum, brushes, and machine surfaces.
Inspect brushes for wear and replace if necessary.
Document the polishing parameters and observations in the batch record.
precautions: Do not overload the polishing drum beyond recommended capacity.
Use appropriate polishing time to avoid excessive friction and capsule damage.
Ensure proper dust extraction to maintain clean environment.
Check capsule integrity after polishing to ensure no breakage.
Maintain moderate rotation speed to prevent capsule damage.
Clean the machine regularly to prevent powder buildup.
Replace worn brushes promptly to maintain polishing efficiency.
Wear appropriate PPE including mask and gloves.
Ensure proper ventilation in the polishing area.
